frame.name: FR_Cognizer_affecting.legitimacy
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes to accept some mental <fen>Content</fen> as legitimate or good, either because of a state of affairs serving as <fen>Evidence</fen>, or because of a <fen>Persuader</fen> who expresses, through language or otherwise, their wish to get the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to change their mind. <ex>FR-EX:<fex name="Evidence">Son divorce</fex> <fex name="Cognizer">l'</fex> a <t>converti</t> au <fex name="Content">célibat</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex> <asf>Distinctions with other frames</asf>: <ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>FR_Attempt_suasion.legitimacy</frframe> : In FR_Cognizer.legitimacy in that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has actually changed their mind. <ex></ex>
<asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : Results from the merge of Suasion and Eventive_cognizer_affecting, and the splitting into .to_do, .veracity and .legitimacy, based on whether the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is convinced to perform an action or that some content is true or legitimate.</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The person whose mind the <fen>Persuader</fen> seeks to change.</def-root>

FE.name: Persuader
FE.definition: <def-root>The person who intends through the use of language or otherwise to get another person to accept the mental <fen>Content</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of affairs that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> accepts as legitimate or good as a result of the <fen>Persuader</fen>'s words</def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>A piece of written or spoken material that changes the mind of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. <ex>FR-EX:<fex name="Medium">Son discours</fex> les a <t>rallié</t> à cette idée.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evidence
FE.definition: <def-root>The eventuality or mental content which motivates the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to change his/her mind. <ex>FR-EX:<fex name="Evidence">Son divorce</fex> <fex name="Cognizer">l'</fex> a <t>converti</t> au <fex name="Content">célibat</fex>.</ex></def-root>
